p.subject: Abraham Lincoln, Stephen Douglas and the Civil War

titlepage.titleproper: Guide to the Hitchcock Family Papers1834-1876
titlepage.author: Finding aid prepared by SV, 2007

did.head: Descriptive Summary

address.addressline: Hanna Holborn Gray Special Collections Research Center

did.abstract: This collection is made up of the correspondence, business papers, and assorted miscellany of Dexter and Sheldon Hitchcock, and their families between 1834 and 1878. Of interest to the economic historian will be the shipping receipts and bills of lading in the business papers of Dexter Hitchcock, 1834-1835, and the various personal account books for the post Civil War period in Folder 6. There are also two interesting letters dealing with western lands in the correspondence of Sheldon Hitchcock, and a group of letters written by soldiers in the Union Army to family and friends in Aurora, Illinois.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

prefercite.head: Citation
prefercite.p: When quoting material from this collection, the preferred citation is: Hitchcock Family. Papers, [Box #, Folder #], Hanna Holborn Gray Special Collections Research Center, University of Chicago Library

scopecontent.head: Scope Note
scopecontent.p: This collection is made up of the correspondence, business papers, and assorted miscellany of Dexter and Sheldon Hitchcock, and their families between 1834 and 1878. Of interest to the economic historian will be the shipping receipts and bills of lading in the business papers of Dexter Hitchcock, 1834-1835, and the various personal account books for the post Civil War period in Folder 6. There are also two interesting letters dealing with western lands in the correspondence of Sheldon Hitchcock, and a group of letters written by soldiers in the Union Army to family and friends in Aurora, Illinois.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Resources
relatedmaterial.p: The following related resources are located in the Department of Special Collections:

did.unittitle: Correspondence of Dexter Hitchcock, Mobile, Alabama, 1834-1835

list.item: (1) A pencil copy of a letter to his sister informing her of his determination to go to Mobile
(2) 15 letters to or from P. S. Gerald, G. C. Knight, C. M. Rogers, and his brother, Warren Hitchcock in Ireland, 1834-1835
(3) Letter from H. W. Russell addressed to Hitchcock in Baltimore
(1) 9 items; shipping receipts, bills of lading, memos of sales
(2) 9 items; Bills and records of personal expenses
(3) Miscellaneous; Poetry, possibly of Dexter Hitchcock, but more probably that of P. S. Gerald

did.unittitle: Correspondence of Sheldon Hitchcock, Suffield, Connecticut and Aurora, Illinois, 1839-1861

list.item: 16 letters, business and personal, two of them undated
(1) 9 items: bills and public notices pursuant to affairs of the Suffield, Connecticut District School, 1842-1845
(2) 15 items; bills and business memoranda of Sheldon Hitchcock, 1835-1860

did.unittitle: Correspondence of Union soldiers with friends in Aurora, Illinois

list.item: (3) Account book of Sheldon Hitchcock, Aurora, Illinois, with entries dated 1857, 1861
(4) Account of Year's Expenses, 1869; Alice C. Hitchcock
(5) Expense Account of E. K. and Alice C. Isbell, 1873-1878
(6) Pamphlet; Catalogue of Shults, Wiley, & Wickes, Fruit and Produce Commission Merchants, New York, 1860
